Welcome to Contact’s project’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))¶
main.index(request: Request)¶
async main.startup()¶

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactBase, db: Session, user: User)¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactBase: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User)¶
The get_contact function takes in a contact_id and returns the corresponding Contact object.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the Contact to be retrieved. db (Session): A database session for querying Contacts from the database. user (User): The User who is requesting this information, used to ensure that they are authorized to access it.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be retrieved

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is authorized to access this contact

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(offset: int, limit: int, db: Session, user: User)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • offset – int: Specify the number of contacts to skip

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – User: Filter the contacts by user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session, user: User)¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. db (Session): A connection to the database. user (User): The user who is removing this contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Ensure that the user is authorized to delete a contact

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_birthday(db: Session, user: User)¶
The search_birthday function searches the database for contacts whose birthday is within a week of today’s date.

It returns a list of all such contacts.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Identify the user that is currently logged in

Returns:

A list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.search_contacts(name: str, fullname: str, email: str, db: Session, user: User)¶
The search_contacts function searches for contacts in the database.
Args:

name (str): The contact’s name. fullname (str): The contact’s fullname. email (str): The contact’s email address.

Parameters:

  • name – str: Search for a contact by name

  • fullname – str: Search for a contact by fullname

  • email – str: Search for a contact by email address

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

  • user – User: Filter the results by user

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, body: ContactBase, db: Session, user: User)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. body (ContactBase): The updated information for the specified contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • body – ContactBase: Pass the contact information to update

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Check if the user is logged in

Returns:

The contact that was updated

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserSchema, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_user_by_email function takes an email address and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar_url(email: str, url: str | None, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar_url function updates the avatar url of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the user by email

  • url – str | None: Allow for the url to be nullable

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object, which is the same as what we get from our get_user_by_email function

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session)¶
The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. token (str | None): The new refresh token to set for the user. If None, then no change is made and an error is logged instead. db (Session): A database session that will be used to commit changes if necessary.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Get the user’s id and email

  • token – str | None: Specify the type of the token parameter

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactBase, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactBase: Specify the type of data that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session into the function

  • user – User: Get the user id from the current user

Returns:

The new contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contact function is used to retrieve a single contact from the database. It takes in an integer representing the ID of the contact, and returns a Contact object.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the contact id that is passed in the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – User: Get the current user, and the db: session parameter is used to get a database session

Returns:

A contact object, which is defined in the models

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.read_contacts(offset: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • offset – int: Specify the starting point of the query

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be removed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.search_contacts(db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search_contacts function is used to search for contacts that have a birthday in the next 7 days.

The function takes in a database session and an authenticated user as parameters. It then calls the repository_contacts.search_birthday function, which returns all contacts with birthdays within 7 days of today’s date.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – User: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A list of contacts with a birthday in the next month

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactBase, contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
The function takes three arguments:

  • body: A ContactBase object containing the new values for the contact.

  • contact_id: An integer representing the ID of an existing contact to be updated.

  • db (optional): A Session object used to connect to and query a database, if not provided, one will be created automatically using get_db().

Parameters:

  • body – ContactBase: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository function

  • user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contactbase object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.get_current_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used by the

get_current_user endpoint. It returns the current user, if any, based on their authentication token. If no user is found for the given token, an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) will be raised.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Get the file from the request body

  • user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies that they are correct, and then returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A token, but the user does not have any information

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token (bearer).

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the authorization header from the request

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A new access_token and refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(username: str, response: Response, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to reset their password. The function takes in a username and returns an image of the open_check.png file.

Parameters:

  • username – str: Get the username from the url

  • response – Response: Set the response headers

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A fileresponse object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserSchema object as input, and returns the newly created user. If an account with that email already exists, it raises an HTTP 409 error.

Parameters:

  • body – UserSchema: Get the data from the request body

  • bt – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A new user, but it also takes a backgroundtasks object as an argument

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = '1234567890'¶
cache = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, as well as when it was issued (iat) and when it expires (exp). The iat and exp values are added to the data dict before encoding.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded into the token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s information,

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user who requested a new access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, otherwise raises an HTTPException with status code 401.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our secret key and algorithm, then returning the subject (sub) field of the payload.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Decode the token

Returns:

The email address associated with the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is being hashed

Returns:

The password hash

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Get the password from the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password in the database with the one that is entered by a user

Returns:

True if the password is correct, and false otherwise

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to verify their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:
-email: the user’s email address, which is used as a recipient for the message and also as part of

the token verification payload. This parameter must be of type EmailStr (a custom class from pydantic) so that it can be validated before being passed into this function. If validation fails, then an error will be raised by pydantic.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the template

Returns:

A coroutine, which is a special type of object that can be used with await or yield from

Doc-author:

Trelent
